item.title: EMFT Notes
item.description: I’ve compiled a few notes on electromagnetic field theory (mainly electrostatics thus far), a subject that has always eluded me until recently when things really started to click. I make no apologies for any profanity contained therein. Peruse if you want: that good shit The notes are ordered more or less according to the curriculum of the relevant course at Chalmers, that is to say they follow the axiomatic approach, starting with the fundamental postulates and building upon them step by step.

item.title: First post
item.description: Intro Hi, this is just a test. Some maths $$ \oint_S \vec E \cdot d\vec s = \frac{Q_{\text{encl}}}{\varepsilon_0}$$ A bitta code Don’t get to astonished, it’s just a bit o' code. int x = 100; int main(){ funclol(); }
